page.title: 14 Rushden Town Football Club
page.content: Rushden play in the Southern League, Midland Division playing 38 games a season. They are also in the F.A. Cup, F.A. Vase and County Senior Cup. The reserves play in their own league and United Counties Cup. They also run a youth team. The bar pays most costs. When a match is to be played they send a letter to the opposing team with details of the match. The visiting team sends Rushden a team list to print in the programmes. On match day the groundsman lines the pitch and puts out the corner flags and nets. It costs a pound for adults and 50p for children to watch a match Two days after the Bradford fire (May 1985) the fire brigade came to inspect the stand. It was found unsafe and needed changes as it was wood: exits are to be made larger; seating reduced to 250 and rubbish underneath cleared.
